Details: Both outputs represent JSON configurations for ETL jobs transferring data from CSV files to Snowflake with similar transformation steps. Key differences include job naming conventions, target table specifications, column mapping approaches, and connection object structures. Overall semantic alignment is strong with moderate structural variations.

Both outputs address the same core ETL objective: reading CSV data, applying transformations (filtering active status, renaming columns), and loading to Snowflake. The semantic intent and business logic are highly aligned. Minor differences in naming conventions and configuration organization do not affect the underlying purpose and functionality.

Overall structure follows identical patterns with 'steps' array containing Source->Transformation->Target flow. Key structural differences: Matillion_Agent uses 'FileToSnowflakeMappingJob' (line 3) vs Informatica_Agent 'FileToSnowflake_ETL_Job' (line 3), different target_object names (line 45 vs 45), and load configuration organization varies (lines 46-65 vs 46-70). Connection objects have different property sets (lines 66-85).

Valid JSON structure with proper syntax. All required properties present and correctly formatted. Minor issue: column mapping references 'old_column_name' in target mapping (line 52) but transformation renames it to 'new_column_name', creating potential inconsistency.
